intro: Otostegia arabica, commonly known as the Arabian milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Otostegia arabica is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It has been used traditionally in some regions for medicinal purposes.
